alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 11 at 9:09PM PDT until August 12 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...Very Low RH and Gusty Winds in FWZs 284, 285, and 624 Friday afternoons and evenings... .Gusty south to southwest winds combined with very low RH will lead to critical fire weather conditions Friday afternoon and evening across portions of south central Oregon and northeastern California. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 9 PM PDT FRIDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 284 AND 285 IN CALIFORNIA AND PORTIONS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624 IN OREGON... * Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: In Northern CA Fire Zones...284...285. In South Central OR Fire Zone....624. * Wind: Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts 20 to 30 mph. * Humidity: 7-15 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD Precautionary/preparedness actions... Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens. &&

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest
